snippet: The ruling provides a reprieve from the May 31 deadline for about 900 people who remain in 45 hotels.
abstract: New York State Judge Margaret A Chan rules that New York City cannot yet end its hotel program for Hurricane Sandy victims displaced by storm; ruling provides reprieve for 900 people in 375 displaced homes across city who remain in 45 hotels.
lead_paragraph: The ruling provides a reprieve from the May 31 deadline for about 900 people who remain in 45 hotels.

headline.main: Judge Orders Extension of Hotel Program for Hurricane Sandy Evacuees
headline.print_headline: Judge Orders Extension of Hotel Program for Hurricane Sandy Evacuees
